message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
I need to respond to 10 statements about AI in education as a Serbian teacher. I should provide thoughtful, balanced responses that reflect both the benefits and concerns of AI in educational settings. Let me consider each statement:

[TT4G35A]: "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans." - This is a realistic benefit. AI tools can help generate ideas and drafts. I'd say "Agree"

[TT4G35B]: "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities." - AI has potential for personalization. I'd say "Agree"

[TT4G35C]: "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually." - AI can help with personalized support. I'd say "Agree"

[TT4G35D]: "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs)." - This is a real benefit, though still developing. I'd say "Agree"

[TT4G35E]: "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks." - This is definitely true. I'd say "Strongly agree"

[TT4G35F]: "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own." - This is a real risk/concern. I'd say "Agree"

[TT4G35G]: "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct." - AI can make mistakes and inappropriate suggestions. I'd say "Agree"

[TT4G35H]: "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions." - This is a real concern about AI systems. I'd say "Agree"

[TT4G35I]: "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data." - This is a significant concern. I'd say "Agree"

[TT4G35J]: "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students." - This is possible if AI isn't well-designed or monitored. 

For this last one, I'd also say "Agree" - poorly implemented AI could indeed recommend teaching methods that don't align with sound educational practice or student needs.
